refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: pam-config adjusts predefined PAM config files.

listitem.para: The new configuration will be activated regardless if there are other local changes.
Prints out a list of all supported modules to stdout.

refsect2.title: MODIFIER OPTIONS
refsect2.para: Use the following options to specifiy the action you want pam-config to apply. They need to be followed by a supported module option. See .

listitem.para: Add options or new PAM modules to existing PAM configuration files.
Create new PAM configuration files for plain UNIX authentication, overwriting existing ones.
Remove options or PAM modules from existing PAM configuration files.
Print a list of types and the corresponding module options for the queried PAM module.
Do some sanity checks on the current common PAM configuration files.

refsect2.title: SUPPORTED PAM MODULES
refsect2.para: This is a list of modules supported by pam-config. They are split into two categories: global and single service modules.

refsect3.title: GLOBAL MODULES
refsect3.para: The global modules get inserted into the common-{account,auth,password,session} files which are included by the single service files.

refsect1.title: NOTES
refsect1.para: The configuration for gobal service modules written by pam-config is ignored by the system if the common-{account,auth,password,session} symlinks don't point to the common-{account,auth,password,session}-pc files.

listitem.para: Enable pam_umask.so whether installed or not, and print debug information during the process.
